data.word: The book is on the table.
data.explanation: <On> indicates position on a surface

data.word: I'll see you at 3 o'clock.
data.explanation: <At> is used with specific times

data.word: She walked through the park.
data.explanation: <Through> indicates movement from one side to another

data.word: The cat is under the bed.
data.explanation: <Under> indicates position below something

data.word: We met in December.
data.explanation: <In> is used with months, years, and seasons

data.word: He ran towards the station.
data.explanation: <Towards> indicates direction of movement

data.word: There's a picture above the fireplace.
data.explanation: <Above> indicates position higher than something

data.word: The meeting is on Friday.
data.explanation: <On> is used with days of the week

data.word: Water flows down the river.
data.explanation: <Down> indicates downward movement

data.word: The keys are in my pocket.
data.explanation: <In> indicates position inside something

data.word: I wake up in the morning.
data.explanation: <In> is used with parts of the day

data.word: She climbed up the mountain.
data.explanation: <Up> indicates upward movement

data.word: The shop is between the bank and the post office.
data.explanation: <Between> indicates position in the middle of two things

data.word: I'll finish this by tomorrow.
data.explanation: <By> indicates a deadline

data.word: The ball rolled across the field.
data.explanation: <Across> indicates movement from one side to the other

data.word: The restaurant is next to the cinema.
data.explanation: <Next to> indicates adjacent position

data.word: She's been working since 9 AM.
data.explanation: <Since> indicates the starting point of an action

data.word: He jumped over the fence.
data.explanation: <Over> indicates movement above and across

data.word: The library is behind the school.
data.explanation: <Behind> indicates position at the back of something

data.word: We studied for three hours.
data.explanation: <For> indicates duration of time

data.word: She walked along the beach.
data.explanation: <Along> indicates movement following a line or path

data.word: The pharmacy is opposite the hospital.
data.explanation: <Opposite> indicates position facing something

data.word: The concert starts at midnight.
data.explanation: <At> is used with specific times including midnight and noon

data.word: The plane flew around the clouds.
data.explanation: <Around> indicates circular movement or avoiding something

data.word: There's a garden in front of the house.
data.explanation: <In front of> indicates position facing something

data.word: I'll call you during lunch break.
data.explanation: <During> indicates when something happens within a period

data.word: She drove past the school.
data.explanation: <Past> indicates movement beyond a point

data.word: The bird is among the trees.
data.explanation: <Among> indicates position surrounded by multiple things

data.word: We'll leave before sunset.
data.explanation: <Before> indicates earlier than a specific time

data.word: He walked into the room.
data.explanation: <Into> indicates movement from outside to inside

data.word: The hotel is near the airport.
data.explanation: <Near> indicates close proximity

data.word: She arrived after the meeting started.
data.explanation: <After> indicates later than a specific time

data.word: The cat jumped out of the box.
data.explanation: <Out of> indicates movement from inside to outside

data.word: The coffee shop is within walking distance.
data.explanation: <Within> indicates inside a boundary or limit

data.word: I'll see you throughout the week.
data.explanation: <Throughout> indicates during the entire period

data.word: She ran away from the dog.
data.explanation: <Away from> indicates movement in the opposite direction

data.word: The museum is beyond the bridge.
data.explanation: <Beyond> indicates position further than something

data.word: We'll meet until 5 PM.
data.explanation: <Until> indicates the end point of an action

data.word: He walked beside his friend.
data.explanation: <Beside> indicates movement next to someone or something

data.word: The store is outside the mall.
data.explanation: <Outside> indicates position not inside something
